situation: At a Chicago Food Truck Festival

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: Yo, this taco truck is straight fire! You tried these yet?

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Not yet, but they’re calling my name. Long line, though!

dialogue.speaker: Tyler
dialogue.text: Worth the wait, trust me. I’m already on my second round.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Dang, you’re living large. Save some for the rest of us!

explanations.definition: A casual greeting to get attention, similar to 'hey.'
explanations.context: Tyler uses it to start the conversation excitedly.
Describing the taco truck’s food as amazing.

explanations.definition: Something that feels very tempting or appealing.
explanations.context: Emma feels drawn to the tacos.

explanations.definition: Justifies the time or effort spent.
explanations.context: Tyler suggests the tacos are good enough to wait in line for.
Emma jokingly says Tyler is indulging by eating multiple tacos.

situation: At a Tech Startup Meeting in Seattle

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Alright, team, let’s hit the ground running on this project.

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: Sounds good. I’m pumped to dive into the UX redesign.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: Awesome. Can you take point on the user testing?

dialogue.speaker: Liam
dialogue.text: For sure, I’ll loop in the beta testers by Friday.

explanations.definition: To start a task quickly and energetically.
explanations.context: Sarah wants the team to begin the project with momentum.
Liam is eager about the UX redesign.

explanations.definition: To take the lead or main responsibility.
explanations.context: Sarah asks Liam to lead the user testing.

explanations.definition: To include or inform someone in a process.
explanations.context: Liam will involve the beta testers in the project.
